sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for measuring the temperature of liquids and environments.
sections.scope: Applicable to laboratory measurements in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Power ON the digital thermometer and check the display.
Clean the probe with distilled water or an alcohol swab before use.
Immerse the probe into the material to be measured.
Wait for the reading to stabilize and record the temperature.
Clean the probe thoroughly after each measurement.
Switch OFF the thermometer after use to conserve battery.
Verify the accuracy of the thermometer against a calibrated reference annually.
Store the thermometer in its protective case.
precautions: Do not exceed the temperature range specified for the thermometer.
Avoid bending or stressing the probe cable.
Do not expose the digital unit to extreme moisture or heat.
Replace batteries promptly to avoid erroneous readings.
Clean the probe immediately after measuring corrosive liquids.
